page.title: 07FARMING CROPS AND PRACTICES
page.content: The farms in the area produce mostly arable crops including fruit such as: cherries, pears, apples and plums. Vegetables such as: beans, potatoes, peas, carrots, beetroot, cabbages and lettuce are also grown. Wheat and barley are the most common crops, while it is not uncommon to see sheep grazing in the orchards. Thus some land has to be used for treated grasses for silage. The farmers work seven days a week on the land, and the hours are long especially at harvest, which can last up to three months.Each of the farms covers about 700 acres of land which is separated out for the growing of the various crops.Land types vary from the flat and dry to lush U shaped valleys which will support orchards.The farms in the area have a great advantage in that the M2 motorway provides easy and quick access to markets.
